About Me

Cansu Demir is a second year PhD student in Geological Sciences at the University of Texas at Austin. She was born and raised in Ankara, Turkey. She completed her undergraduate and Master’s education at Middle East Technical University with a degree in Environmental Engineering.

After graduating from Master’s, she moved to the US by awarded Fulbright Scholarship to pursue her doctoral research.

Her research focus is on hydrogeology and groundwater modeling. Currently, she is specifically interested in groundwater dynamics of the coastal permafrost regions in the Arctic.

Water is the driving force of all nature. Leonardo Da Vinci

She is currently working under the supervision of Prof. M. Bayani Cardenas.

Thank You for reading!
